title: What's the best way to unlock a phone? - Quora

response.answer_text: Unlocking your phone means breaking the carrier-lock imposed on many handsets that stops them working on rival cellular networks. By unlocking your phone you can bring your phone to a carrier on a compatible network and sign on to their services. Now there are many software we can use to solve this problem.iMyFone lockwiper is one of them. To get your iOS device back to operable condition, iMyFone LockWiper reinstalls the system firmware. Now, normally this is something that requires some tech skills, but iMyFone LockWiper is a self-service program that easily walks you through the process. When you’re done, the Apple ID on the device is gone so you can change to a different Apple ID or create a new one. That, in turn, gives you the ability to use any iCloud service and enjoy all of the features of your Apple ID. For example, future iOS versions will be installed “over the air” automatically again.

Assuming its android phone and its SIM unlock. CAUTION:DEPENDING ON WHERE YOU ARE UNLOCKING MAYBE ILLEGAL Some of the general steps to unlock any phone are google your phone and unlocking procedure (majority of times you need root to unlock) unlock the bootloader.flash a custom recovery.flash supersu to gain root on android.and then unlock your deviceIf its normal pattern/pin lock if your device is running 4.4 or lower go to bootloader (google how to get into bootloader of your phone) and wipe data/factory reset, you will loose all your apps but your data like photos and docs will be safe.

If it’s the phone password you are having problems with, follow these steps: Shut down the phone ;Start phone by pressing “Power Button and Volume down or Up rocker key” and holding them down at the same time, until you enter in Recovery Mode;In Recovery Mode, you should see a Factory reset option. Navigate to it by using the volume keys and select by pressing the power button;Now , your phone will reboot and you will not be asked about the phones password.NOTE: By doing a Factory Reset, not only do you remove the access password, but you also delete all the data on the phone, NOT including the SD card. All the data on the SD card will still be there.

You can unlock phone using code. You can get this code from IMEI number. You have contract with company. Pay your contract amount to company. And then ask them to unlock mobile. You can also call to customer care number. You want to use your smartphone. Connect your mobile to computer. Start flash software and Install ROM to mobile. Now restart your mobile.

There are 2 definitions Carrier unlocking : this means to remove a carrier contract if your phone is under a carrier and unlock itBootloader unlocking: this is basically unlocking the software potential of an Android phone … bootloader unlocking means you get to root and install custom recoveries like TWRP

Since the poster has posed almost 4,000 questions and 37,868 Edits, this is probably a theoretical question and not real. Also, they are not asking how to find who lost it. But the answer is simple and the same as for the hundreds of times this has been asked: You can’t.

If it’s your phone and your contract is paid off. The carrier is legally required in the US to unlock it.
Best way is to go on youtube and unlock it at your own risk. If you bought the phone, you can wait till you pay it off and can get the code from your carrier service / phone provider.
